item.title: Constructuon fencing blocking footpath, 5th July
item.description:
For over 2 years now the footpath on the northern side of the pavement has been blocked by metal fencing outside a newly constructed building. The builders seem to have simply not completed this part of their building and now nobody can use that side of the pavement, forcing children and people to cross the street or walk in the road at that section.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Wyvil Road, Vauxhall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree covered in weed, 5th July
item.description:
I am writing to report an issue concerning neighbour's overgrown tree and surrounding garden area. The garden is currently heavily overgrown and covered in weeds, which is affecting the appearance and maintenance of my property. Of particular concern is a tree located within the garden that has grown significantly. It is currently estimated to be between 8 to 10 metres tall. The size and condition of the tree may pose potential safety risks, and it is contributing to the general neglect of the area. I would appreciate it if the council could inspect the site and take any appropriate action to address this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Grange Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins along Thames Path, 5th July
item.description:
I am concerned about the overflowing bins along the Thames Path, in the area between West Thamesmead (SE28 0NJ) and the Royal Arsenal Woolwich area. I walk this route often on my commute to Woolwich Arsenal train station. The public bins do not appear to have been collected for some time, with rubbish now overflowing onto the pavement, which will attract vermin and pests. The heat from the weather will also make matters worst. This is an environmental issue on a public route that is used often, especially in warm weather as locals try to enjoy the path, leading to more waste being produced and requiring collection. Please get the rubbish collected and ensure regular collection. I don’t understand why the waste collection in this area has been neglected, especially at a time when more waste is being produced due to the weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erebus Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous speeding and increased traffic, 5th July
item.description:
The gate is continuously left open, which leads to high levels of traffic in the area that was previously closed. Black BMWs are driving super fast endangering children who have walk and cycle on the road, because pavements are too narrow.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lyme Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
